item.title: Docs: Internet
item.description:
观点/表达

  • xxx has many benefits. However, it can be addictive.
  • Criminals increasingly use the Internet to steal people’s money.
  • Many people are involved in online gaming, playing with people who they have never met.
  • You can share links to things you find interesting
  • It’s important to think about who can see your personal information

优点:

  • 立即获得信息 -> 方便
  • 有大量信息 -> 让我们获得知识, 了解世界
  • 有趣的图片, 视频 -> 娱乐休闲
  • 交朋友，来自世界各地的，不同语言的有趣的人
  • 有许多线上商店和服务 -> 足不出户就可以买到东西等
  • instant access to information on almost any subject

缺点:

  • 充斥着没有经过筛选的海量信息 -> 无用信息/虚假信息 -> 错误的认知
  • 含有暴力/色情内容 -> 对孩子不好
  • 在网上社交而不是线下 -> 缺乏社区意识,
  • 网络游戏吸引 -> 沉迷 -> 孩子学习
  • 网络安全: 个人信息暴露在网上 -> 被坏人利用 -> 造成损失

冲击:

  • 对传统产业如报纸, 线下商店等的冲击
  • 对娱乐/交流方式的冲击

行动:

  • 家长控制小孩能看到的内容
  • 自身学会辨识网上信息
  • 政府/公司，严格限制发布内容
  • 鼓励人们线下社交

词汇/词伙

  • xxxx are available online.
  • convenient, conveniently.
  • instant messaging, video messaging
  • it has revolutionised communication.
  • violence or sexual videos.
  • contain offensive content.
  • surfing the net
  • browse, browser
  • subscribe to a site / video channel
  • contact list
  • interactive programs
  • social networking sites like twitter, facebook
  • keep in touch with their friends
  • post a video, update your status
  • profile
  • share links
  • notifications
  • personal information
  • check privacy settings

  • 跟着 Simon 学写作

item.title: Docs: Internet vs Newspaper
item.description:
主题

internet, newspaper

观点/表达

  • xxx has many benefits. However, it can be addictive.

词汇

  • digital edition

题目

Although more and more people read news on the Internet, newspapers will remain the most important source of news. Do you agree or disagree?

范文: The Internet is beginning to rival newspapers as the best place to find information about what is happening in the world. I believe that this trend will continue, and the Internet will soon be just as important as the traditional press.

On the one hand, I believe that newspapers will continue to be a vital source of information, even in the Internet age. Firstly, newspapers are the most traditional means of communicating the news, and not everyone wants to or is able to use the Internet instead. For example, old people or those in rural areas might not have the ability or opportunity to get online, while many of us simply prefer newspapers even if we do have Internet access. Secondly, newspapers can be trusted as reliable sources of news because they employ professional journalists and editors. Finally, many people like the experience of holding and reading a paper rather than looking at a computer screen.

However, the Internet is likely to become just as popular as newspapers for a variety of reasons. The main reason is that it allows us much faster access to news in real time and wherever we are, on different gadgets and mobile devices. Another key benefit of online news compared to newspapers is the ability to share articles, discuss them with other people, give our views, and even contribute with our own updates on social media. For example, there has been an explosion in the use of platforms like Twitter and YouTube where anyone can share their news and views. A final point is that this source of news is less damaging to the environment.

In conclusion, I disagree with the view that newspapers will continue to be the main source of news, because I believe that the Internet will soon be equally important.

练习:

With the development of technology, People can easily access the Internet to find information about what is happening in the world using their smartphones or computers, rather than read the newspaper. I believe that the Internet will finally replace the traditional newspaper in the future.

Instead of reading the newspaper, people now can easily use their laptops or smartphones to access the Internet and find out what is happening in the world. I think that eventually, the traditional newspaper will be replaced by tthe Internet.

In conclusion, I disagree with the view that newspapers could still remain its importance with the impact of the development of the Internet.

item.title: Docs: Phones
item.description:
观点/表达

优点:

  • 最流行的设备, 可以上网,发短信,照相,听音乐,玩游戏…
  • 与朋友随时随地联系 -> 很方便, 维持友谊/关系
  • 将网络装进口袋, 随时触及

缺点:

  • 长时间盯着手机 -> 对眼睛有害
  • 包含暴力/色情内容 -> 对还是不友好
  • 线上社交 -> 缺乏社区意识
  • 有研究称手机辐射对人体健康有害

  • Vocabulary in Use Upper-intermediate Unit33-37
  • 跟着 Simon 学写作

item.title: Docs: Television
item.description:
主题

Television

观点/表达

  • Television has many benefits. However, it can be addictive.
  • Children should not be exposed to violence, swearing or sexual images.
  • Many channels depend on (TV) commercials to make money.

优点:

  • 娱乐方式 -> 工作劳累一天后的放松
  • 各种类型的节目, 喜剧, 电影, 新闻, 纪录片 -> 增长见识, 了解世界

缺点:

  • 长时间盯着屏幕 -> 对眼睛有害
  • 包含暴力/色情内容 -> 对孩子不友好 -> 儿童可能会模仿里面的行为
  • 很多节目没有经过深思熟虑 -> 对社会有消极影响
  • 浪费时间

行动:

  • Advertising during children’s programs should be strictly controlled.
  • TV companies should make more positive and educational programmes.

词汇/词伙

  • wind down, relax, exhausted
  • viewers
  • entertainment channels,
  • comedian, documentaries, talk shows, Cartoons,
  • advertising, advertisement
  • negative impact
  • waste of time

参考

  • Vocabulary in Use Upper-intermediate Unit33-37
  • 跟着 Simon 学写作
